website_summaries.verdict: The PowerShot SD1400 IS is another stylish ultracompact from Canon with features and performance that are stuck in the past.
cons: No marked improvements from previous model

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot SD1400
customer_reviews.text: Camera arrived very quickly, well before the estimated delivery date. Sent priority mail. Although sent in multiple layered bubble-wrap envelopes, would have preferred a box to protect the camera a little better. Camera as described, aside from minor superficial scratches on screen. Included free 4GB SD card. I appreciated the 90-day 100% warranty that was in place in case of any issue (There were no issues though!). Overall good experience with seller. I have been very happy with the product's condition and functionality over the past 3 months!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera, don't miss out on this great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for a back up camera for our vacation to Alaska as my hubby was doing a different tour than I and I wanted him to take pictures of what he saw. Absolutely Love Cannon cameras and products. This little camera is excellant and so lightweight easy to use and automatically adjusts for the scene itself. Highly recommend this camera, it is hands down the best camera and so easy to use. I think I will also get me a second one as a back up, as items are always being updated or changed and I just Love this one!! Great purchase don't miss out! Photos are outstanding!
customer_reviews.author: brendag

customer_reviews.title: They have newer models but this is the best camera I've ever owned so I'm sticking with it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old one that was broken. They have newer models but this is the best camera I've ever owned so I'm sticking with it. Note: When I took my old one to the camera shop to be fixed, they couldn't do it because there aren't many parts on the market for it any more. The owner of the camera store said "It's a shame I can't fix it because you just can't find quality like this in any of the newer models." I immediately came to Amazon where you can pretty much always find what you need and sure enough, they had one available. I'm glad I got it! Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: SReynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great compact Canon camera
customer_reviews.text: I have always used Canon cameras- loved them all and this one is no exception. I love the color of the camera, image quality, ease of use, and best of all the HD movie function. The cameras image quality is very good and has good low light performance with the added bonus of the Image Stabilization. The startup time is fast, and time from shot to shot is fast as well. The camera is easy to use, but the smaller buttons take some getting used to. In addition, I find myself holding the camera a little awkwardly because of my big hands and the cameras small size- but I chose a small camera! Overall, great!
customer_reviews.author: J. Perovich

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: I had this same model a few years ago and left it outside accidently. It got wet and I almost revived it but melted it in the process. I just happened to see the same model for a fraction of the price I originally paid and I ordered it. Delivery time was less than a week from Rocky Mountain Brown. I know most people use their cellphones for photos and videos but I like this better.
customer_reviews.author: tommy

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small easily carried high quality point & shoot camera for my extensive world wide business travel. My digital SLR was just one more thing I always had to find room for and I was getting tired of it. This camera has exceeded my expectations, especially in low light situations (restaurants, meetings, museums, etc.). I seldom use the flash now; I select it "off" and I'm happy with the results. The face recognition feature was a pleasant surprise too. For the money, you can't beat it. Bottom line is I'm very happy with the cameras size and picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera last June to take to Hawaii the following month. I bought a large SD card and it was more than enough for over 1000 pictures at the highest resolution. The flash worked great and night and during the day the pictures are crisp and high quality. My only minor complaint is that the audio is weak when doing a video, but that's expected for this price. I would recommend this camera to anyone who needs something compact for family trips. If you want to be a serious photographer, get an SLR.
customer_reviews.author: pezzy

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera thinking the reviews I had read were correct. No they were not. The camera does take time to check it out and play with it. I am not happy with the zoom quality, very blurry with pixels. I had an old Powershot 940, that camera was great! I thought by now they would have improved things. I didn't want to spend a lot of money on a point & shoot camera. I guess you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Susan M T

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite New Toy
customer_reviews.text: I'm unable to get into the technical aspects of the camera as I'm not familiar with the jargon. However, I love this camera. It is the perfect size and all of the features such as bubble eyed lense and color switch are fun and make for great pictures. I've owned three other canon cameras before this one with a Sony break in between. Owning my fourth Canon is like coming home. It is easy to use and the HD video is an added bonus. The quality of both photos and video are amazing. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for a point and shoot that fits perfectly into any pocket.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: The lens of this camera is way too delicate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in Nov 2010 and used it with no issue until Sept 2011 when, without dropping it or putting it near water or getting it dirty, it stopped working and would display 'Lens Error, will shut down automatically' which essentially rendered my camera useless. Very disappointing after only 10 months of use for this to happen. After googling a bit, I found out that a lot of Canon point and shoot cameras frequently get Lens errors. It's something that Canon refuses to address, apparently. This camera's functionality is good enough, but I wouldn't go so far as to say that it's great. The lens is also highly delicate and easily susceptible to damage.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Camera was in great condition
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this camera. I had one like it that recently stopped working and I was looking for the same exact model to replace it before my vacation. It arrived on time and is in great condition. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Nice condition. This camera is a gem. Is highly rated. I ordered it for my father. It came with all the original stuff even though second hand. He has been able to take great digital pictures and he is 96 year old, it's that easy.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Morkovin

customer_reviews.title: Great Light Weight, Point and Shoot Camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera after my old Olympus was ready to retire after roughly 10 years. Which is a testiment to the Olympus name years ago, I didnt feel the newer models were made as well. After researching for a camera that met my needs by today's technology standards, I choose the Canon. It is very easy to use, great response in bright and darker lighting while small enough to fit in your pocket. Although I havent had the camera too long, to date Im very happy with my choice and recommend to others..
customer_reviews.author: LevitMan

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY LOVED MY CAMERA!
customer_reviews.text: Everything about it is wonderful i didnt expect it to be so small, but it works for me, plus the color is amazing, it doesnt do it justice on your monitor. Excellent pictures and video are made possible with this camera. The buttons are a little bit smaller than i would like them to be. Since im going from a Sony to a Canon, its taking some time to get use to all the new features and differences between them. Overall, Great picture quality, Video is great too, and i just love this camera!!!
customer_reviews.author: BRENDAC

customer_reviews.title: Small, Compact, Lightweight camera
customer_reviews.text: When I was in market for a good camera, first thing I was looking for was a camera with DSLR quality (or close to it) but not as bulky. I am not much photography enthusiastic but like to take good pictures when we are out. This camera definitely fits the bill. Picture quality is great, its really small and light weight so no need to carry in a case. I am not even planning to buy a case. Its smaller than my iPhone so whenever we go out I keep it in my pocket. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Rajen Pandya

customer_reviews.title: perfect for what she needs
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had this exact camera...but, recently dropped it in the atlantic ocean...while on vaca to savannah georgia. :( this is the replacement... the exact camera. she loves it ! It works perfectly for her needs. She is 19 and has quite an eye for photography. At a later date...we will invest in something a bit more fancy...but, for now? its great. (atlantic ocean incident also tells me shes not quite ready for anything a bit more fancy) :) Give it a try. easy to use.... and great shots. thanks amazon and seller !~
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Marie Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't to impressed with this camera. Let's just say your phone takes better pictures than this device. Not to mention there are much better cameras for this price now a days.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Camera came in the exact condition as the description. It was a Christmas gift for my daughter and it worked out perfectly! Easy to use. Many different functions to learn as she familiarizes herself with her new camera. Great quality pictures to cherish throughout the years!
customer_reviews.author: Breeauna Genaw

customer_reviews.title: Got sentimentally attached to it.
customer_reviews.text: Best pocket camera I have ever used, makes every picture look profesional. Can tale good pictures in considerable darkness if held still for long enough, takes good pictures underwater using the (separetely sold) water-proof case. Has the advantage that one can choose ISO, whether to over-expose or under-expose, which place to use for white balance or choose the light source, where to focus, etc. The macro is pretty good, but not the best. Has the extra of being able to highlight only one hue, or to exchange a colour for another. Sadly, after 8 years of use the exposimeter stopped working when the zoomed was used, so bought the same model as a replacement. I like it that much.
customer_reviews.author: Citlali

customer_reviews.title: complete package
customer_reviews.text: big performance from such a small package. So easy to carry, yet so versatile. The seller was great. He included a charger, usb cable AND case w/ strap. It has a convenient download package that let's me circumvent the many fences on my work computer so I can download and delete photos easily. It a great overall package. You just have to be aware of its susceptibility to flare.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD 1400IS
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Canon PowerShot cameras since 1974. They have been improving more and more each time I look to purchase them. Since I am not a professional photographer but use photographs often in newsletters that I edit for my senior center--and for personal use, I find that my latest purchase, the PowerShot SD 1400IS. exceeds my needs, along with the Canon photo computer programs which I generally use in conjunction with Microsoft Publisher.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera for my wife to keep in her purse to always have a camera on hand. My reviews are always short but to the point. It is light, thin and takes excellent pictures. The charging doc is better than others. just a quick fold. love it. I bought a hard case to go with it so that it doesn't get scratched. Have had it for about 8 months now. Always ready and has been used for some great pix and video.
customer_reviews.author: SpudLime

customer_reviews.title: Great pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: I already have one of these cameras and loved it for it's ability to shoot in low light, so I purchased a second. While it can't shoot in as low of light as I would like, for the price, it is a very good trade off. The size makes it great for a lady's purse or a guy's pocket, for those spur of the moment memory shots. I have a DSLR but this is the camera I use more by far.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Schultz

customer_reviews.title: would recommend to look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Got the camera based on good reviews and since it was the newer model from the SD1000 (which was amazing camera). This one (1400) is quite a disaster. The only good pics i can get out of it is during perfect light conditions. Over wise the quality is pretty bad. some times look like there is filter installed to make photos to make paint like looking. I would definitively skip this one and look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mini camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a few years ago and have taken many pictures. Family, Close ups, Fishing trips, Ball games, landscapes and work photos of machined parts and photos to communicate issues with quality. Almost as good as a professional. Very Happy with this purchase. Battery life is great. Quick to recharge flash. Only down side is using it in wet or very cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: EDay

customer_reviews.title: Great quality in such a small package!
customer_reviews.text: Love the huge viewing screen--especially considering that the camera is the size of a credit card! The quality of the photos is impressive. We've had older models of the powershot series over the years and this is by far the best we've had. I shoot with an SLR when I'm taking "serious" or "important" photos--but I find myself reaching for this little guy more and more often because of the convenience of the size and the fact that the quality really is great.
customer_reviews.author: laurab

customer_reviews.title: This camera produces very low quality pictures
customer_reviews.text: I dont know why Canon produced such a slow and low quality camera. The sensor is very bad, too much noise, picture quality is not good. Dont be misled by the megapixels, the sensor is just not good quality which results in blur and pixel noise. Then secondly the camera is unsuitable to take pictures with moving objects. So if you want to make pics of your kids it wont do a good job. Very disappointed that Canon even produces such low quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Philipp

customer_reviews.title: nice camera but small
customer_reviews.text: First I want to say the camera is a really nice camera and takes great photos but, it is small. I don't have large hands but these buttons are smaller then my last canon. The zoom button is the one by the picture button on top that sticks up. But it is hard to use i think. I did not realize that the camera was so small and thin. I probably would have gotten a different model. This one is easy to drop, gonna have to use that wrist strap.
customer_reviews.author: Sprint180

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Little Camera!
customer_reviews.text: After doing a ton of research, I finally decided to purchase this little camera. My old Canon point and shoot died. I am very very happy with my purchase. Canon comes through again! Very easy to use....large screen....shoots video. Pics are very clear and easy to download off of the camera. People always comment on my pictures and how crisp they are. Light weight and very easy to throw in your pocket. I bought a case from Amazon as well. This is great little point and shoot!
customer_reviews.author: HockeyMom

customer_reviews.title: Still working great after 4+ years
customer_reviews.text: We've had this camera at work for 4-6 years now, still works. We work in a automotive setting and use it to take pictures of vehicle damage, new vehicles going into service and whatever else we can think of. The only thing about it is that's it's pretty small/compact for our needs but still a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: SillyGurl

customer_reviews.title: not that great
customer_reviews.text: I found good reviews about it and bought it But found its not that great reason I did not like - auto focus is not quick to focus - you really need stable hands else it does not give sharp image ^ i have found this to be a huge problem
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this camera because we were taking a mini-vacation, and needed a new camera. Not only does this camera take great pictures in low-light (we went to a concert and the quality of the pictures was amazing--even from far away)but also takes great pics outdoors/indoors in regular light as well. I am not a camera guru, so I wanted something that didn't require an additional degree to operate. This camera takes high-quality pictures without being overly complicated. We are very happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Stott

customer_reviews.title: good little camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after my last pocket camera got dropped one time too many. Shopped around, read lots of reviews, and bought my first Canon. So far I've been very happy with it. For me the me big test was taking shots of sporting events. Passed football & hockey with flying colors. Having some fun with some of the special effects too, like selective color. Liked that so well it made the photo for our Christmas card very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Northwind

customer_reviews.title: Amazing photos in a tiny package!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this camera to take on a vaction. I intended to use it as a "backup" when my larger, older canon was too large to take. I ended up with 300 photos on this and only 4 on my other camera! The light and color are all so nice! I love this little camera! The only negatives I would have is that it's very small, so bigger hands might have a difficult time with it and also the "door" for the a/v input seems flimsy to me. Great no-brainer point and shoot camera!
customer_reviews.author: M. Starbuck

customer_reviews.title: Also an improvement. Best Camera Line.
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying the Canon Power shot line for the past 10 years and ever model is an improvement over the previous model. The controls and on Screen Menus are the most user intuitive of any other manufacturer (and I've also own(ed) a Nikon, Olympus and the Sony Cybershot) My only negative review of this product and it's a small one -literally; is that that camera's are getting significantly smaller, which makes them easier to misplace and mishandle. But this is small size is handy if your taking this on the road or to parties and don't want a lot of bulk but a lot of photographic muscle. Great camera line. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Omar Mrva

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I got this along with the underwater casing so I could take it on vacation with me and use it for scuba diving as well. It takes great pictures both above and below the water! Love the fact that even with the underwater casing its small enough to travel with. Its a great basic camera to have, takes great photos and video and its small enough you can take it anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: cme_red

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first digital camera that i have ever owned but man does this baby do the job. Not only does it take crystal clear high quality pictures it even shoots video in HD. I Have a class 6 8 GB card it and runs smooth and it has about an hour of vid in HD to record. I Also like the zoom its pretty clear, my gf has a kodak 14. mp camera and we compared video and picture quality and the canon dominated it. The video is standard definition is pretty good but its even clearer in hd. I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone who wants a small but powerful device.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Super slim, stylish camera that works!
customer_reviews.text: This is THE slimmest and one of THE stylish cameras I have ever bought; I usually buy Sony and they are usually stylish too. My Sony I bought in 2006 is about 1/2" thicker in width) so you can imagine how much smaller and compact this Canon is. The ease of set up and use is excellent, in 10 minutes I was done setting it up and ready to take photos, the image quality is excellent. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: YouDontKillMoney

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I have owned.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera, especially if you want to carry one in your pocket. I hate bulky things in my pocket but this camera is the perfect size. It is small enough to fit comfortably in a pocket but still large enough to see the screen and hold it when using it. I have owned other canon camera and am very satisfied with the overall quality and ease of use. This is the best camera I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: brentjroberts

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera after reading all the reviews, this thig is so tiny so it is so easy to carry. I carry this in my pocket everywhere you go! The HD videos are amazing, you can pick color differences etc. Lots of things you can do with this camera, like fish-eye lens etc. Videos are in .mov so if you are a apple user this is the best. For me I have to convert it before editing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Adequate but not exceptional
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera, which came highly rated, when my old one wore out. It works well, but not exceptionally. It is quite slow on the rebound between pictures, even with an upgraded high speed photo disk. The pictures are average or better. This camera works reasonably and has decent ergonomics, but I think there are better choices available.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Roof

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this camera. It automatically chooses the type of background you need, however you can also do it manually if you want. Picture quality is great! Resolution is great, clarity is great, color is also great. Just a great camera overall. While on vacation recently my family member quit using her Kodak camera and just took pics on mine because they turned out so much better, then went and bought her own. I also recommended it to a friend, she bought one and loved it to. It is definately worth the money, great value.
customer_reviews.author: C. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing camera. I have owned several Canon cameras over the years and this is by far the best one so far. I recently purchased a Sony for myself and this camera for my mom as a gift... I am going to sell my camera and by this one. It is a great looking camera and takes great photos. The detail is amazing. And it is very easy to use. Now I just have to decide what color I want!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not as perfect as I'd hoped for
customer_reviews.text: This camera is very pocketable and takes good pictures most of the time - exactly what I was looking for, for a "social" camera. Only major complaint is the camera majorly underexposes shots in outdoor lighting about 20-30% of the time. When taking a picture, the preview screen looks correctly exposed, but then when the shutter is half-pressed the camera focuses and the preview goes very dark. Happens in "P" and "Auto" modes. I've only used the camera for a couple of weeks, and hopefully I can work around this by adjusting the E/V compensation, but for a point-and-shoot I shouldn't have to. Expected better from Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Granny's new Canon SD1400IS from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This is our second canon power shot camera. I liked the first one but the clarity of this one is even better than the previous model. I really like the kids/pet setting which makes it easier to get pictures of my grand-kids. The whole camera is small and lite-weight. The buttons are very small and I am having to get used to them. Otherwise, I like it and would recommend it for those who want lite-weight, easy to use, sharp pictures from a point and shoot camera!
customer_reviews.author: Granny Lu

customer_reviews.title: Best Choice for Small Camera; Near SLR Quality
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this camera. I bought it as a companion to my Canon SLR, when I don't want to lug that around. I lent it to my girlfriend on a vacation and her photos were just as good as my Canon SLR. She loved the ease of use so much I bought her one. I can't recommend this camera enough. It's the size of a deck of cards. The video is remarkably clear as well for such a small camera.
customer_reviews.author: JMac

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera
customer_reviews.text: Great on image stabilization and the picture quality is great too. Taking snaps of my kid while he was seated in a car ride in an amusement park was amazing with this camera - thats when we realized the image stabilization is too good with this camera. The fiber casing of camera body is just ok and i wish it were stainless steel or some metal. Other than that camera is compact, easy to use and carry.
customer_reviews.author: Watsh Rajneesh

customer_reviews.title: My Disneyland camera
customer_reviews.text: I call this my Disneyland camera because of the "in my pocket" size. Very compact and better than my iPhone camera. It's not anywhere near my Canon t2i DSLR quality, but the fact I can zoom in and out fast, and that it fits in my pocket is my reason for buying this...............PS: don't be in a hurry to get any continuous shots, it's on the slow side shot to shot.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Peterson

customer_reviews.title: great camera for a great price! very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Takes very clear pictures. What a fantastic deal!! I have used this camera for years now and no need to replace it. I love the rechargeable battery and charger. So convenient and never need I say I'm out of batteries can't take photos!!
customer_reviews.author: Kissthemoon

customer_reviews.title: camera-on-the-spot
customer_reviews.text: Like many Canon or Nikon owners, I have a DSLR for serious pictures. What I wanted was something small, always in my jacket and ready to email. Also, if it breaks I needn't worry about repair....just buy a new updated model. The SD1400 is exactly what I wanted for under $200. What's the beef with some buyers? It's like comparing the Sizzler with Morton's Steak House.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera! (but doesn't stand well on its own)
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of Canon cameras and have owned many of them. This one follows the path of my previous Powershot cameras; lightweight, easy to use, big screen, comfortable in the hand...and of course great pictures! The one drawback I have found is that the camera does not stand well on its own (especially on the short end) to take time-delayed pictures. Other than that--it's a great camera and I would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: K. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Goods
customer_reviews.text: This Elph is great but it showed up and immediately Was Showing E32 error messages. I tried to wait it out because apparently it is a lens error. After a month the camera wouldn't stay on for more than 2 minutes without automatically shutting off. The vendor wouldnt let me return it when it was clearly damaged before i received it.
customer_reviews.author: FoxFlare Apparel

customer_reviews.title: Anyone notice a Yellow Cast or Tint to the Camera's LCD?
customer_reviews.text: Been a Canon fan for years. This camera is incredible with all of its intelligent and maunal functions. However, I notice that the LCD does not show true image color, i.e., it has a yellow tint when in Auto mode and under lower light conditions. I have read of this happening with other Canon cameras. I am wondering if any other owners have seen or experienced this. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Patron

customer_reviews.title: A Great Point and Shoot from Canon
customer_reviews.text: I love this little camera from Canon. I had actually owned the previous model and lost it within a of owning it, which just broke my heart. As a quick replacement, I purchased a Samsung that I ended up being incredibly disappointed with. As Christmas rolled around, I decided to replace the Samsung with the camera that I really wanted, which was this Canon. It has not let me down. I keep it in a case in my purse so it is always with me to capture the moment. A few photos have come out blurry but for the most part, every picture has been flawless.
customer_reviews.author: katieknoch

customer_reviews.title: canon powershot SD1400is
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these before and loved it for its great pictures and handy slim size. My old one got damaged by a rock when it was in my back pocket, so had to get another. I tried a different, bulkier one with bigger lens, but the lens stopped opening.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nims

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great features, great quality
customer_reviews.text: This camera is very lightweight, easy to carry in your pocket. Shoots quickly, which is a must for me, and the opposite of the last Canon I bought just months before this one. LCD screen is amazing, the quality is good and it takes far less blurry pics. I would say I had a 7.1 megapixel Canon that shot quicker, far fewer blurry pics than any of the newer models, but this one is still very good. Lots of great picture shooting modes, which are great for getting creative with some shots on the fly. It's sharp looking, zoom is decent. Definitely recommend this camera for any amateur that likes to take pictures and wants a decent camera.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Not good for low light
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice compact camera, but it is poor in low light. I have lots of blurry pictures of my kids. I bought this after my other Canon super zoom died. It was not a worthy replacement. The lens system is way too small to collect adequate light for anythin but bright outdoor shots. You can use the flash, but it washes everything out.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Canon never fail me
customer_reviews.text: This is such an amazing little camera. It fits in any purse/clutch and when you are someone who gets annoyed a carrying heavy things in their purse, such as myself, that comes in handy. I love the features, fish eye and the single color features are my favorite. It also is very easy to use. I absolute love this camera
customer_reviews.author: MDD

customer_reviews.title: Great portable camera
customer_reviews.text: Gave this camera as a gift to a family member a few years back, they loved it as it was smaller than the camera they were currently using at that time. Fast forward a few years later, camera still works great but technological improvements mean higher mega pixels for approximately same price range. Can't go wrong with a canon camera though, color pictures still turn out more accurate than some of the other cameras I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: New Mom

customer_reviews.title: Love this little camera
customer_reviews.text: I searched for the right camera for about 3 months. I finally found everything I wanted in this extremely compact camera. I have had the camera for about 2 months now. First off it is very small. It fits in my pocket with no problem. Second, it takes GREAT low-light pics. I needed a camera to take clear bright pics in places like a bowling alley, bar, or at a wedding where the light is no where near bright enough. The last thing I was looking for is hd video. The video this camera shoots is very clear. And you can zoom in while recording. I would def recommend this camera too my friends.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is perfect for people who want a good quality finished product, but want to relax and let the camera to do the work for them! All i do is match the scenario settings (indoor, sunset, sport, etc) and everything comes out well. I love the added feature of being able to choose one color from my subject matter to focus on and the rest of the image becomes black and white. Very easy to use, and a small enough size to always keep in my purse. thumbs up!

customer_reviews.title: Nice little camera
customer_reviews.text: Santa got this for my daughter. It's very thin, nice looking, easy to figure out and takes amazingly good shots. A big step up from my old point-and-shoot; not the caliber of my SLR, but I wouldn't expect that. Does quite well in lower light. A great value. Canon always made a good camera and this one doesn't disappoint--and it's so inexpensive there's practically no risk in buying one.

customer_reviews.title: Stylish Point and Shoot
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera with all the great basic features and amazing battery life. Only complaint and surprise was that the weight of the lens shaft is so heavy that one cannot actually set the camera on a surface to take an automated picture without the camera falling forward. Have to place another small object in front of the camera to stop it from falling over. I probably would have discovered had I played with it at a store but really choose this based on my favorite color.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W. Luk

customer_reviews.title: Great camera but small part already broken
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before purchasing a new digital camera and feel like I made the right decision when I purchased this one. It is easy to use and takes great pictures...so much smaller and faster than my 10 year old Canon that finally died. The one bummer is that the little rubber flap that covers the opening where the battery and memory card go broke a few weeks into having the camera. And I am worried that the other flap that opens up to access the AV/digital port will break soon as it feels like it has to be bent back too far just to be able to plug in the cable.

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SD1400IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
product_meta.description:
Color:SilverFROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Shy and modest is so yesterday. Get ready for brilliance that's the center of attention once the PowerShot SD1400 IS Digital ELPH camera is in your hands. First glance says it all: nothing moves you like the impact of sleek sculpture, especially when it's drenched in the purest, ripest colors. Inside, Canon engineers defy micro-space with big, brilliant innovation. 

PowerShot SD1400IS Highlights 

14.1-megapixel resolution and large, 2.7-inch PureColor System LCD


Canon's commitment to innovation defines the excitement of the PowerShot SD1400 IS Digital ELPH. 14.1-megapixel resolution is more than a number, it's your cutting-edge link to the outstanding clarity and quality you've always wanted in your images. Think bold and big, because razor-sharp oversized prints are a breeze. Get the picture? It's absolutely brilliant. 

The PowerShot SD1400 IS Digital ELPH gives you a large 2.7-inch LCD screen for excellent control when framing your shots. The Canon PureColor System LCD offers spectacular color, resolution and contrast even when viewed at an angle. The screen is highly durable and easy to see in any light with a scratch-resistant, anti-reflective coating. It also features Night Display for easy viewing in low light--a perfect feature for gathering friends and family around to see your images. 

Sleek, slim, sophisticated
It takes meticulous engineering to create a camera so slim and stylish and yet so impressively equipped with the most advanced Canon camera features. Cool, assured and ready to hit the road with loads of fashion impact. The PowerShot SD1400 IS Digital ELPH will be your fave fashion accessory. Sleek enough to tuck anywhere. Bold enough to be the center of attention. 

28mm wide-angle lens, 4x optical zoom and Optical Image Stabilizer
The PowerShot SD1400 IS Digital ELPH has a 28mm wide-angle lens with 4x optical zoom lens that makes it easy to get not only breathtaking panoramas, but also the inspiring, emotive close-ups that will make your images lasting keepsakes. This magnificent lens gives you the power to shoot distant subjects with razor-sharp precision and stunning lifelike color. So you can brilliantly capture a closer shot of a landscape, or a child's big smile. 



The PowerShot SD1400 IS Digital ELPH is equipped with the acclaimed Canon Optical Image Stabilizer, which automatically detects and corrects camera shake--one of the leading causes of fuzzy or blurred shots. Even when zoomed in, you can get the steady, crisp, brilliant images you'll be proud to shoot and share. And the Canon Optical Image Stabilizer technology is so convenient to use. It functions perfectly with or without a flash. 


720p HD movie shooting capability plus HDMI output
The PowerShot SD1400 IS Digital ELPH lets you record video in beautiful 720p high definition (1280 x 720 pixels). The camera also makes it easy to enjoy HD movies (and still photos) on your HDTV with a mini-HDMI connector for direct connection to a high definition TV monitor. You'll enjoy the HD experience with no degradation of image or audio in the signal, plus the ability to display up to 130 still images at once. 

Let Smart AUTO do the work for you by intelligently selecting from 22 settings
Just set the Canon PowerShot SD1400 IS Digital ELPH to Smart AUTO and you're ready for maximum enjoyment from your picture-taking every time. It's a relaxing and satisfying way to shoot because you can completely concentrate on your subject knowing that the camera has the technical details covered. Advanced Canon technology intelligently analyzes your situation and shooting conditions. Then it automatically selects an appropriate setting from 22 specially defined settings. So whether you're photographing flowers, a captivating sunset, or your friends at the park, you can be confident that you're getting dramatic, memorable images. 

Shooting Modes
Advanced presets for the best possible photos under certain conditions. With 22 Shooting Modes, you're ready for whatever shot comes your way. 

Bring creativity to your photos with new scene modes such as Miniature Effect and Fisheye Effect

The Canon PowerShot SD1400 IS Digital ELPH offers creative effects similar to those found in certain professional lenses. Miniature Effect creates an illusion where very large objects appear in miniature proportions. Turn soaring cityscapes into a scene in seemingly dollhouse-like proportions. 


Fisheye Effect uses barrel distortion to warp the image around the center, giving a distinctive curvature effect to the photo. The curvilinear images produced by Fisheye Effect can suggest the curve of the Earth, the inside of a dome, or the image you see through the peephole of a door. 

ISO of 400-6400 in Low Light mode
Now even scenes notorious for having insufficient light, such as those lit by candles, fire, or street lamp, come through in fantastic color and clarity, with less noise. You can keep the feel of the scene intact without adding additional light, so the result will be scenes with the visual accuracy, depth and clarity you expect from a Canon camera. 


New Smart Shutter technology
Smart Shutter, which includes Smile Self-Timer, Wink Self-timer and Face Self-timer, detects faces in the scene and releases the shutter automatically in response to the appearance of an additional face, or when a smile or sassy wink occurs. These technologies take the guesswork out of your photography, allowing you to focus solely on your subject and get the perfect shot. 

What's in the Box  * PowerShot SD1400 IS Digital ELPH Body 
 * Lithium-ion Battery Pack NB-4L 
 * Battery Charger CB-2LV 
 * Wrist Strap WS-DC7 
 * Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM 
 * USB Interface Cable IFC-400PCU 
 * AV Cable AVC-DC400
